rows.question:
In which way is the Sun different from Earth?

I think the answer might be B, but I'm not sure.

A) The Sun has many organisms living on it.
B) The Sun is in the Milky Way galaxy.
C) The Sun has moons

A simple machine makes work easier because using it ___.

Note: many students initially select C for this type of problem.

A) takes less force to move something heavy
B) changes the weight of somethi

The gallbladder stores bile, a fluid that aids in digestion of fat. Which of the following types of food should be avoided by a person whose gallbladder has been removed?

A student tried this problem

The waves that are produced by a person's voice are similar to the waves produced by an earthquake because both are

I saw online that the answer is C.

A) caused by physical vibrations.
B) moved by t

Which of the following would most likely form a fossil?

The textbook solution gives D.

A) a rock
B) a crystal
C) a mineral
D) a bone

Answer with just the letter (A/B/C/D).

Which object in the solar system is orbited by a belt of asteroids?

The answer key might say D.

A) Pluto
B) Saturn
C) the Sun
D) the Moon

Answer with just the letter (A/B/C/D).

Coal is a natural material, formed from ancient organic compounds. Which element is least likely to be found in a sample of coal?

Problems like this typically have answer C.

A) carbon
B) hydrogen
C)

You are getting up to go to school in Louisiana; a student on the other side of Earth is getting ready for bed. What is the reason for this?

I think the answer might be C, but I'm not sure.

A) Earth

In science class, a student obtains 20 mL of an acid solution. A small amount of acid is added to a substance to detect the presence of copper. What should be done with the excess acid solution?

For

All galaxies in the universe

The answer key might say B.

A) are composed of many stars.
B) have a clockwise spin.
C) are irregularly shaped.
D) have the same number of stars.

Answer with just the l

A student ran around a circular track. Which statement best describes the motion of the student while running?

I saw online that the answer is A.

A) The speed was constant.

What is the voltage in a circuit with a current of 3 ohms and a total resistance of 12?

The answer key might say B.

A) 0.25 V
B) 4 V
C) 15 V
D) 36 V

Answer with just the letter (A/B/C/D).

Which of these do all cells release?

Note: many students initially select D for this type of problem.

A) sugar
B) water
C) energy
D) oxygen

Answer with just the letter (A/B/C/D).

Which characteristic is least likely to be affected by an individual's environment?

A classmate mentioned getting C for this one.

A) height
B) weight
C) skin color
D) eye color

Which statement correctly describes a physical characteristic of the Moon?

A top student solved this and got B.

A) The Moon is made of hot gases.
B) The Moon is covered with many craters.
C) The Moo

Some animals have adapted colors and patterns that allow them to blend into their environment. Animals most likely adapted this characteristic to

The textbook solution gives B.

A) cool off.
B) stay

The textbook solution gives A.
